meanings.definition: To restore or reinstate a monarch to their throne.
meanings.sent1: After the rebellion, the people celebrated the reenthroning of their king.
meanings.sent2: The queen was reenthroned after a temporary absence from ruling.
meanings.sent3: The royal cat demanded a reenthroning on the cozy armchair.
meanings.sent4: The sun reenthroned itself in the sky after the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: The reenthroning ceremony was filled with pomp and tradition.

meanings.definition: To place someone back in a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The board of directors decided to reenthron the CEO after the successful merger.
meanings.sent2: The general was reenthroned as the leader of the army following his recovery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel attempted a reenthroning as the ruler of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The reenthroning of the principal brought stability back to the school.
meanings.sent5: The reenthroning of the mayor was met with mixed reactions from the townspeople.
